top_categories.workout_context: North Wales Gravel X's UK Wales, British gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
80ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At North Wales Gravel X, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic North Wales Gravel X's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of North Wales Gravel X. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At North Wales Gravel X, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Varied gradients on uK Wales gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
When someone attacks on uK Wales gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
50 miles on uK Wales gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on uK Wales gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 50 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for North Wales Gravel X’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at North Wales Gravel X requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on uk wales gravel to build confidence. Expect: uk wales, british gravel, uk.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Over Under to prepare you for 50 miles of uk wales gravel in Ruthin, Wales, UK.
